citation.article-title: Shimia marina gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel bacterium of the Roseobacter clade isolated from biofilm in a coastal fish farm
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Shimia (Shi′mi.a. N.L. fem. n. Shimia named in honour of Dr Jae H. Shim, for his contributions to marine plankton ecology in Korea).
Growth is heterotrophic and strictly aerobic.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is UQ-10.
Cells do not contain bacteriochlorophyll a.
The genus is a member of the family Rhodobacteraceae.
The type species is Shimia marina.
